result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eugene Irving Parker

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eugene Irving Parker in court.  Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre appeared by video for Eugene Irving Parker.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense is pursuing veterans treatment court. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Initial Demand for Discovery, filed.

Defendant Eugene Irving Parker in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a status conference. Defendant does not want a public defender to represent him. Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Christin Saint Pierre to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $25.00 per month beginning on 11-01-2022 and then the 1st of each month there after.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. Case is adjourned for a status of counsel in Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Eugene Irving Parker not in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defendant cannot appear by Zoom, does not have an attorney, and requests an in-person hearing.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Eugene Irving Parker in court.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-23-2022 @2:30p
